intro: Argyrolobium dasycarpum, commonly known as the woolly burr veldt, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by the development of hairy, woody pods. Its adaptability to arid conditions makes it a hardy species often found in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant's unique appearance and resilience contribute to its ecological significance in its native environment.
